Article.ArticleTitle: Direct time delay computation applied to the O + O<sub>2</sub> exchange reaction at low energy: Lifetime spectrum of O<sub>3</sub> <sup>*</sup> species.

AbstractText: We report full quantum dynamical calculations for lifetimes of scattering resonances, among which are true metastable states, of the intermediate heavy ozone complex <sup>50</sup>O<sub>3</sub> <sup>*</sup> of the <sup>18</sup>O + <sup>16</sup>O<sup>16</sup>O reaction, for any value of the total angular momentum quantum number J. We show that computations for nonzero values of J are mandatory in order to properly analyze resonances and time delays, with a view to establish a somewhat comprehensive eigenlife spectrum of the complex O<sub>3</sub> <sup>*</sup>. Calculations have been performed in a given low to moderate energy range, including the interval between zero-point energies (ZPEs) of reagents and product species. Quasi-bound states tend to be more numerous, and eigenlifetimes themselves are seen to increase with J, reaching unusually large values for J = 30. A very dense forest of O<sub>3</sub> <sup>*</sup> species is pictured already for J greater than 20, especially at the highest energies considered, leading to a quasi-continuum of metastable states. On the contrary, they appear as rather sparse and isolated at J = 0 and lower energies, including the domain between <sup>18</sup>O<sup>16</sup>O and <sup>16</sup>O<sup>16</sup>O ZPEs, embedded among many overlapping resonances that turn out to be not long-lived enough to be associated with genuine metastable states.
